title: Augusta County: John Scott to Samuel Hunt, December 20, 1865
summary: Frustrated with the slow distribution of key resources to AMA schools in Staunton, Scott discusses the hardships of teaching in the Valley. He highlights his efforts to reform the "drinking" boys in the town and says that local whites have very little interest in "making anything of a 'nigger.'"
keywords: African Americans, Education, Race Relations, Economy, Women, Church/Religious Activities, American Civil War
